Game Flow:
  • Day 1 will last a maximum of three weeks; later days will be up to two weeks. There will not be a lynch if the game goes to night due to this deadline--someone has to consciously place a hammer vote.
  • I will probably be online when the deadline strikes, and I'll lock the thread at that point. But if I'm not, and you beat me to the punch with a hammer, you can have it. The lynch will go through normally in that case.
  • You may choose to go to night without a lynch before then, by having at least half of the players vote: No Lynch. (That's half, not a full majority.)
  • Votes should be posted in the format vote: Anarchy or VOTE: Anarchy. I expect them to be entirely bold, but don't try to exploit this to trick someone. I will register misspellings and nicknames if I can figure out who you're referring to. You do not have to unvote, but you're welcome to do so anyway.
  • When a player has the majority of the votes at a single point, it is dead and the game goes to twilight. Feel free to post in twilight.
  • Night deadlines are "whenever I next get online 48 hours after [the lynch scene/finding any necessary replacements]." I will not announce day sooner, even if all choices are in. If I'm missing your choice and I know you're online, I'll contact you and give you a minute to think of something.
  • Failing that, the game will just have to go to day without you. If any anti-town faction with unlimited shots misses a chance to kill, then a fallback kill will still go through--trying to confirm people through their inactivity is not recommended. This default option only applies to the scum nightkill and compulsory roles. Any other abilities will simply go unused.

    What is and isn't allowed:
  • Please don't be a giant raging asshole. I'm asking you nicely here.
  • Unless otherwise specified, living players can't communicate with each other out of the thread. Anyone who's an exception to this rule will get a private topic. They're free to talk outside of it, if they have a method they prefer. Transcripts from that are appreciated, but if you're Skyping or something, don't worry about taping every single thing you say. I trust you.
  • You may rant to both dead players and nonplaying friends, although you're encouraged to first make sure that said friends aren't interested in replacing in with you. (I am of course available, sympathetic and discreet. Feel free to AIM me at CaffieneDeity, or Skype me at unvote.) Regardless of where you found them, rantbuddies may not reveal their own opinions on the game, and nothing about your discussion should surface publicly before the game is over.
  • "Dead" means "dead." Don't AIM the guy who hammered you to tell him what a scumbag he is, and definitely don't keep making game-relevant posts. Just lie there...and think dead thoughts.
  • Read your role PM and summarize it in your confirmation. Unless I've posted it publicly, you may not reference its wording in-thread. In fact, don't reference the wording of any private messages anyone sends you about this game. No timestamps. Nothing.
  • Do not try to encourage others to break the above rule. Don't push me.
  • The ooc font and [mech] tags are my domain. Don't use them. Don't pretend to use them.
  • The smallest font size you can use is size 70. Don't use a font color with the intent of making it more difficult to see, either.

    What to expect from me:
  • Do try to be active, and leave a notification in-thread and/or by PM if that's not possible. I will automatically prod anyone who has not posted over 48 hours--and that's pretty lenient; you are expected to post more than once every two days. If asked, I will disclose the status of any prod.
  • If you don't post in-thread in response to a prod within 48 hours, I will seek a replacement to take over your role. Future prods must be responded to within 24 hours. (I might bump this back up later at my discretion, but don't count on it.) I may seek replacement for a player who lurks consistently without breaking this rule, but you'll have some sort of warning first.
  • I'll try to post one votecount per page, as close to the top as possible. If I make errors, please correct me.
  • I'm one of those "spirit-of-the-game"-type hippies. This ruleset is a guideline. I reserve the right to change it at will, and even in extreme circumstances enforce it retroactively. If a strategy feels shady to you, you might want to take it up with me first.

    Spectators
  • Got a song request? Feel free to call in via PM, AIM (CaffieneDeity) or Skype (unvote), and I'll see what I can do. Keep it mainstream, please: nothing too obscure to have a karaoke version on YouTube. This is not a Song Contest!

    Miscellaneous:
  • Play to win, but do try to have fun while you're at it.

This setup contains 3 mafia and 10 town-aligned players; there are no other alignments.
The mafia can speak during the day; this might hinge on an encryptor or it might be an automatic ability.

At least one player will receive:
Vanilla townie wrote:Welcome to Mini 1689! The game thread is here.

You are a vanilla townie. During the day, you should try to lynch the mafia.

You win when all of the mafia are dead.

Alright, so I finally finished my reread of the game (as well as catching up to the latest posts), I still feel like I have an extremely nebulous hold on this game (there's also the issue that I don't think the bottom three really fit as a team at this point) but I wanted to lay out where I stand with everyone in the game so far. I really hope over time people end up above the line. I know this post is going to probably be rambly and ponderous but I'd like everyone to read it and engage with me on it.

TOWN

chamber: Not really sure where people's concerns about his play are coming from (I think some people are just really unfamiliar with him?), but his play here massively fits with the town meta that I know of him. I can follow/understand most of his thought processes even if I don't agree with him (ex: I can understand why he asked about AP's smiley usage in #69 even if the question was a bit weird). From what I remember, chamber really hates being scum and is far less engaged in the game, so posts like #168 where he voices his frustration that no one understands his GC vote/unstated reasoning make more sense from him as town - I think he'd be far less inclined to give a shit as scum. I liked his "trying to prevent AP from self destructing" post in #220, think he'd just let AP continue to do so if he were scum. Him trying to get GC and Yos to stop flooding the thread in #308 is immensely town, he'd surely just let them continue to drown the thread out if he were scum here. Finally, #221 is a post that is just so off beat in terms of its "internal dialogue" style of explaining his thought process that I would be really shocked if scum came up with that. Overall, I'd probably just spiral into permanent state of existential pessimism if he were scum in this game.

Pegasus30: I've already stated quite a bit of why I think this dude's really town, but it bears repeating. I really liked the timing and statement of the townreads on myself and chamber in #46, given that no one had stated a read on us yet, it shows that he is willing to take the initiative while scumhunting. His thoughts on AP and myself in #170 seem to be colored by a paranoia that scum would want to pounce on trying to mislynch him due to his perception as an easy-to-lynch player and I think these bias are more likely to come from newbie town as opposed to scum. I like that he took the extra effort to verify Yosarian's meta analysis on AP in #176 and wanting to back out of a potential wall war with AP in #178, the latter specifically because I feel like getting into a back-and-forth with AP at this stage would give him free content and would allow him to clutter the thread if he were scum. He is also more forceful with people than I would expect newbie scum to be in posts like #295 (“Ap, you want to be engaged...”; “Empire, you are standing on the sidelines despite being active...”) and his frustration at not having strong townreads impeding his gamesolving in #392 reads really genuine to me. This dude is another dude I'd be really surprised if he flipped scum.

AP: While I did find AP's entrance into the game a bit forced and over the top, I can buy that this is just a playstyle thing and not really alignment indicative. It's hard to really dig in and find specific points for why I think he's town but I will say that I liked the introspective bits/efforts to be transparent that appear throughout his posting (ex: #64 – “I considered editing parts of my post to make it less 3-dimensional..."; #124 – “I do feel pressured to contribute, but that is coming from within”; #162 – “Talking about myself is just going to make people care less about what I say..."). #65 and the subsequent explanation in #67 suggest that he is posting without a filter, which I think is way more likely town. And I think his whole thing where he claimed VT and threatened to self hammer is a towntell in that it is more likely to come from a demotivated town-AP.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

GC: While I'm nowhere near as confident as the above three that he's town, I do think he's done some solidly town stuff enough to place him just under the line. I actually thought #112 was a town post in that I think as scum he'd have just made up some bullshit or manufactured a case against AP at that point (and I certainly think GC is competent enough as scum to have done so). I don't see the scum motivation in posting given that it de facto undermines your push to admit you don't have any specific points against that player, if that player is town and you are trying to get them lynched. All in all, I like the way he handles himself in his responses to Yosarian, he hits the right frustrated town tone and his points all resonate with me, particularly those articulated in #277. Bonus: he also does the food tell in #208 >_>.

Quilford: I think the little mini case that Quilford presented in #47 is slightly more likely to come from town in that town are more likely to experience that feeling of deja vu / make the connection between the exact wording of someone else's play in this game and their scum play in another game. The subsequent questioning of UT also seems like he's genuinely trying to get a read on him. Overall, Quilford generally is hitting the natural/snarky/sassy town tone that is more similar to the TM Twin Trap rather than the more robotic and stiff tone he had in Mafia on the Metro. Would really like to see his thoughts/reads when he catches up, though.

UT: I already touched on this before but the reasoning he uses in #95 to suspect me in the TM Large Theme where we were town together and I think it makes him slightly more likely to be town. I liked #216 in that UT's level of mad/frustration seems similar to how he reacted to suspicion in the TM Large Theme and from memory UT is far less inclined to give a shit when he's scum.

DrDolittle: This one is very weak but I liked that he went out of his way to look up the number of times AP used a certain smiley as it shows some proactive effort. I skimmed MacBeth (where he was scum) very briefly earlier today and he does seem to be playing very differently than he is here in that in MacBeth he was a lot more "by-the-book" and formal in his approach but I need to dig a bit deeper in order to verify this.

NULL

SKrew: I liked where he was going in his questioning during the early game but it's weak and I want to see where he goes when he has the time to fully catch up here and state his thoughts.

Axxle: Despite having had some content, I've got nothing on this guy. Hopefully, whoever jumps into this slot will be a lot more readable for me.

Normally, I'd consider the meta diving into AP's early game play in #98 to be a towntell but it gives off the impression to me that he was looking for stuff to suit his conclusions (Ex: “I'm seeing the kind of self-conscious stuff he's talking about here, but I'm still not getting the "I'm neutral, don't mind me, I'm just here" vibe that bugged me here.”). In post 467, Empire wrote: #255 still feels off – like, Yos didn’t even have a read on Quaroath so I still don’t really get why he is making this argument since it assumes Quaroath is town and GC is trying to chain up his mislynch. I’m trying to figure out if he’s just like confirmation biasing or something.


It's not conformation bias at all, and I never assumed anything about Quaroath's alignment.

Looking for scum on day 1, there are certain types of behavior I look for; one of them is trying to push for mislynches, which scum generally do very effectively on day 1. (Someone actually went through and did statistical analysis on several years of mafia games at one point, and found that town lynches worse then random on day 1. The reason is that town are only acting slightly better then random, while scum are actively trying to push mislynches, so the end result is worse then random.)

Obviously, when you're looking for that kind of behavior on day 1, you have to do it without actually knowing anyone's alignment. So what you say is "this post by X looks like it matches the 'scum trying to push a mislynch on Y'" behavior, based on the (fairly subtle) ways that that kind of behavior can look different from "town honestly looking for scum" behavior.

I mean, how else can you scumhunt on day 1 when you don't have anything solid? Day 1 scumhunting is all based behavior patterns, hunches, meta, or guesses. And one of biggest differences between town and scum play is
that townies are actually trying to find scum, while scum are trying to get townies mislynched, and that can look a little bit different.

Now, later on in the game after a few flips, you start to know who was scum and who was town, you could use that fact and have a better shot at figuring out the difference when looking back, but you don't have that on day 1, so you just have to look for behavioral tells being made by the attacker to try to figure out his motives without knowing the alignment of the person being attacked. Which is what I was trying to do. It's...not an exact science, but it's still one of the biggest divergences between town and scum playstyles on day 1.

However, I looked a bit at Karma Mafia and he does seem to be playing slightly differently than there. I’m still leaning towards him being scum but I am definitely not sure about it at all.
@Yos – do you have a more recent scum game than Karma Mafia?


I haven't played at all in a long time. I came back about a year ago for Oldy Mafia, and hadn't played for a while before that. So, yeah, Karma Mafia's probably the most recent. Before that, I think Succession Mafia, maybe?

I'm a little surprised no one caught onto what was odd about Quaroth's posts: his interaction with Empire. Every time he posts towards Empire, his posts seem forced and manufactured - like he doesn't actually have anything to say but is trying to find stuff to snipe at Empire about. At first, I thought he and Empire were scum distancing but after Empire's latest list of reads, I'm unsure (and I'll get to Empire's list in a bit). But even if Empire is town, Quar's posts are worthy of a close look.

I recommend everyone keep his posts in isolation open in a different window as you read through:

Post 59 - The weird jump at Empire calling him "foolish" and then oscillating back-and-forth with no conclusion. Then he criticizes Empire for his impatience, calls it strange and leaves it there without offering his opinion. The criticisms themselves feel overblown.

Post 202 - His completely misrepresents what Empire was saying about Untrod. I thought it was fairly obvious that Empire was responding to AP. Empire had said that scum would latch onto his early posts. AP replied that only Untrod latched onto them. Empire responded by saying that Untrod had in the past incorrectly called Empire scum (implying that Untrod latching onto his posts isn't cause for a scumread). Quar then twists it as if Empire was saying that he and Untrod were both town here because Untrod read Empire wrongly in the past. Quar could have misunderstood but I just hate the totally overblown response "WHAT!??!?!? Please explain this using logical thought processes" in caps with multiple punctuation and exclamation marks.

This is in fact a recurring theme through many of his posts. In the same post (202), look at his chiding of AP:

"Your job of friggen defend yourself. It doesn’t help CATCH SCUM to self hammer, so what the hell? Do you want to lose?"

"The appeal to emotion here is just... Wha…? I don’t buy into what Pegasus is selling, but ..I don't get the woe is me at all."

"The whole self-hammering VT line is a crock of shit, regardless of your role. if you are a VT, why the HELL would you just give in and suicide? How the hell does your death help catch the scum if you self-hammer because QQ? Why should anyone defend you... do it your own damn self."

The underlying theme that sets me off the hardest is the extreme overreaction. "Wha...?" "WHAT!?!??!" "crock of shit" "why the HELL." It doesn't feel like genuine emotion in a relevant context. Feels more like he is bullshitting his reactions. I wondered if it was simply a playstyle clash and whether his reaction simply appear scummy to a more restrained player like me.

So, I went through his old games to check how much of it is just playstyle. My impression was that he reacts strongly as both alignments but his overreactions as scum seem significantly more pronounced and over the top. This was what I was hoping Empire would point out when he committed to reading through Quar's games. There's another thing I want talk about but I want to see if Empire does mention it before I elaborate.

I have a good few hours for this game which I may not have the following week (although I'll still be checking in) so I'll try and post all of my thoughts so far. I'll start with Quilford as I seem to have forgotten about him mostly and he looks like a viable wagon.

Post 47 - My first initial townread developed from here. It is weak though and I could easily see scum joking around but his later explanation that he was trying to move the game forward fits in more with a town motive.

Post 63 - Telling AP that his posts were self-conscious is not a bad description of AP's play up to that point.

Post 89 - Asking Untrod the difference between Empire's and AP's self-consciousness shows some beneath-the-surface scumhunting. It at least feels like he's keeping track of Untrod's reads and reasons for them. I particularly like that he's tracking Untrod because Untrod seems to have recently won a game as scum where Quilford was town and it makes sense to be wary of him.

Post 91 - Clarification that the Untrod push was done for reactions.

Post 96 - Follow-up question to Untrod seems fairly specific and makes sense (Untrod's response also clarifies things pretty well though).

Post 183 - Jumps on the AP wagon. I don't find it suspicious at all due to his earlier comments about AP's self-consciousness. I also think Quilford who had a marginal suspicion of AP would grill Untrod because Untrod seemed to be townreading AP for what Quilford considered inconsistent reasoning.

Post 184 - Follows up on his previous question which I think town are marginally more likely to do.

Post 192 - I don't agree with this unvote.

Post 203 - Decent enough explanation. Personally I think if AP is scum, it would have been worth the risk to let him self-hammer but I think it is more a difference in mafia philosophies.

Post 204 - Calls out Quaroth for lecturing AP calling Quar's lecture "terrible." I'm inclined to agree.

Post 241 - This makes sense with his evolving reads and I don't find any of it objectionable. And he's right about Untrod getting defensive.

Post 473 - Probably one of the few posts I don't like. I think plenty has happened that he could post opinions about.

Post 482 - I disagree that replacing out has anything to do with alignment. I don't know if this is just a difference of opinion though.

Post 533 - Doesn't mind a Quar wagon. Later says Bookitty and SleepyKrew are the worst people on counterwagon. I agree.

Questions:

1) You say that your initial push on Untrod was done for reactions. Did you find anything helpful based on the reactions?
2) Why do you find replace-outs to be concerning? Have there been events in your past games where scum replaced out? Have you in the past as town called replace-outs suspicious? If so, can you link them for me.
3) It would be very helpful if you can post your updated reads. I think quite a lot has happened since you excused yourself due to exams and I want your take on the latest events.

Other thoughts:

Going through his posts strengthened my townread on him. Most of Quilford's posts have involved scumhunting at a reasonable depth. He sometimes posts things I agree with which by itself isn't a huge indicator of alignment but are small points in favor of thinking we have similar motivations. His suspicion changes according to things that happen in thread in a reasonable manner (AP being scum and then later town when he found out that AP was trying to change stuff). He's fairly engaged with the game and follows up on his questions fairly often. He seems to be particularly wary of Untrod who won as scum against him in the past which I find reasonable.

I don't think it is completely impossible for a scum player to post like he did but the sum total of content he put in thread makes me lean far, far more in the town direction than scum. He's not a wagon I'll support today. In fact, I want the wagoners to put together coherent reasons why they are voting him and in what way they feel that he has been "active-lurking" or sliding below the radar. I'd like an explanation for the votes on him.

Dr. Dolittle seems like the other popular wagon. My first impression was that he is barely even following the game. I don't know how much is just a "lurk" type playstyle that some people tend to have and how much is alignment-indicative because it is so blatant that he's not even trying. I'm not really going to be convinced by "Dr. Dolittle's posts are bad and trolling" but if anyone can provide evidence that Dr. plays well as town that he's not doing here, I'm going to look into it more.

Post 28 - His first serious post of the game is a vote for AngryPidgeon for not voting. Seems fine to get the game started.

Post 70 - Goes to research the number of times AP uses emoticons upon Chamber mentioning it. Some people (Empire I think) seemed to have found this town. I don't get it. My first impression was it looked like busywork that accomplishes nothing and I don't think frequency of emoticon usage would be remotely related to alignments. That seems to be more of a playstyle trait. It's followed up by more discussion with Chamber about how to search for them. Chamber votes him following this conversation so I'm curious to see whether he thought this was scummy

Post 197 - This is the type of post that lacks depth and seems a lot like how scum normally talk about townies. "Contributing faction?" What does that mean. Good logic? That's alignment independent a lot of the time. I understand the Quilford vote and I can understand why Quilford's hop on to the AP wagon can be perceived as opportunistic by someone like Dr. who doesn't seem to engaged in the game enough to note that Quilford had previous expressed suspicion of AP's opening posts.

Post 233 - Referencing Untrod's (uncle's) post in Post 219 seems bad on the surface but in this case, I actually like it as it seemed like he truly believed Quilford's jump on AP was bad and was looking for a more articulate player to say it for him which uncle seemed to have done effectively. Gut says it isn't what scum would do but I don't have anything to substantiate that.

Post 256 - Asking Quil for his scumreads seem like he's trying to get a better read there which is vaguely townish.

Post 351 - Why do you expect Axxle to have an opinion on Yos vs GC? You don't seem to have one yourself so it seems unreasonable to expect him to.

Post 353 - Votes Axxle. For not having an opinion on Yos/GC? Meh.

Post 355 - Calls Axxle's posts "strangely neutral." I can see where he's coming from with this as Axxle hasn't made any strong pushes so far. I wonder if Axxle is the type to usually make such pushes. Is he? However, reading the entire back-and-forth between Axxle and Dr.Dolittle, I think I liked both sides of the argument. Dr. does make good points on Axxle's lack of engagement on GC vs Yos while Axxle defends himself well stating that back-and-forth walls are often difficult to parse through - a sentiment I happen to agree with. A few townpoints for Dr. here.

Post 406 - His explanation for suspecting Axxle was actually quite town although it is a surface level one. I can believe that Dr.Dolittle believes that neutrality is scummy because said neutral person wouldn't want to step on toes.

Post 424 - The questioning of Chamber being obvtown seems reasonable. @ Dolittle, I've since come to the conclusion that Chamber is indeed obvtown but that's a complicated read which I don't feel like explaining at this point. The sentiment that a player isn't playing like he did in a previous game I think is more likely to come from town so Dolittle bringing it up seems town of him although it is a very poor usage of meta.

Post 470 - Mirrors what I was feeling about Empire. It seemed like Empire had the same reads I did except he wasn't pushing any reads. Although later explained by being busy, I'll get to Empire in a bit.

Post 584 - I don't understand the vote on Quar, then the switch to Quil, then the switch to Papa but I feel like "all the cool kids are on the Quar wagon" seems a bit too blatantly scummy for scum to actually admit. But at least he's consistent. I also think it unlikely for a scum to vote Quil, then decide Quil's not scum and then vote someone else. I don't know what specifically he remembered in that one minute that made him think Quil's not scum though.

Questions:

(1) Talk about your AP read more in depth. What is this "good logic" from AP that you saw that you don't think AP would post as scum? What sort of logic would you expect AP to use if he were scum?
(2) What do you mean by "contribution factions?"
(3) What's your own opinion on the Yos/GC walling and have you played with Axxle before? Is he the type to take strong positions on wall wars?
(4) What "weird and irrelevant facts" is Chamber talking about? Specify them for me.
(5) What does a "cupcake" mean as it relates to mafia? What do "jeep's tells" mean and how do they apply to PapaZito?
(6) What did you remember about Quilford in the gap between Post 580 and Post 581 that made you suddenly get this inspiration that Quilford isn't scum?
(7) What about Quilford's response to his AP unvote was as town-motivated as you are claiming it to be? Essentially, I want an elaboration on Post 613
(8) I asked you earlier for your reads and thoughts on the players in this game? I want a response.

Other thoughts:

So, I went in expecting Dr. to be null but I'm actually seeing a lot of town there. Some of his posts made me cringe while others felt like busywork. But through the bad posts, there are several that expose his town motives. The push on Axxle wasn't bad. His changing his mind on Quilford felt like he had actual reasons for it although I want them explained. Some of his sentiments like his concerns about Chamber seem like ones I think town would have whereas scum would be more likely to not want to provoke Chamber, the near-universally agreed upon obvtown.

I understand why he was wagoned as the votes on him came shortly after his cringeworthy posts but the entire sum of posts I think are likelier town than scum. I'm less opposed to his wagon than I am to Quilford but very pessimistic about the chances that he's actually going to flip mafia. Most likely will not be voting here.

Looking at Quil's ISO, he's done three things of substance.


1. The UT meta argument (Post 47, Post 91, and Post 107). This was based off of very weak reasoning, and went nowhere. Which isn't bad in and of itself, but what makes it suspicious is the fact that this empty calorie case it's a large component of Quil's substantive presence in the game.


2. The AP vote/unvote. It's clear that Quil voted AP for awkwardness + Pegasus/Yos points (Post 63, Post 183), which (once again), is fine whatever in and of itself. Here, however, my problem is Quil's voting pattern and - more importantly - his justification for his quick unvote.

Quil unvoted because he didn't want "any derps" giving AP the chance to self-hammer (Post 192). Quil reiterates that someone could have either missed AP's self-hammer claim or would have put AP at L-1 anyways (Post 203). I call shenanigans. AP's self-hammer claim in Post 187 wasn't buried in some massive wall post. It was clearly stated in the single line post - hard to miss, and so I find it suspicious that Quil was concerned that someone would have missed it. The other fear that someone would have put AP at L-1 in any event is also pretty unjustified, seeing as how it was only Page 8; and, in any event, such a vote would have effectively been the hammer so that the person making such a vote would have come under appropriate suspicion.

Which is all to say, Quil's unvote justification looks artificial. He voted AP for perfectly adequate reasons for a Page 8 vote, but the immediate jump off based on the reasons articulated looks like a calculated attempt to look town from a player who knows that the voted player (AP) is frustrated town.

Feeding into this is I also don't buy Quil's explanation of Quil's reading AP town (Post 241, Post 242). The timing doesn't really hold up: Quil claims that he was starting to townread AP immediately after AP's claim of self-hammering (see Post 187 and Post 188), but that was never indicated in Quil's justifications for unvoting. Also, the only thing that could justify Quil's AP town read from the time between Quil's AP vote (Post 183) and Quil's AP townread (Post 241) would be AP's self-hammer claim - which I guess is plausible, but I don't see how that caused a 180 degree spin in Quil's assessment of AP (as opposed to simply being the turning point of Quil's diminishing suspicions of AP).


3. And then there's Quil's push against UT based on the differences between Empire's and AP's awkwardness (Post 89, Post 96, Post 101, Post 241). This is all a weird, pointless discussion for which I could fault Quil and UT equally tbqh. But, once again, its particularly suspicions of Quil in the sense that this is the third pillar of the totality of Quil's substantive contribution to the game.

Going through Bookitty's posts. @ Bookitty, I know you complained about the lack of a case so I'll just address this to you. Post 41 - Doesn't understand what Empire was trying to say. Votes Axxle presumably for his "Bookitty, try not to be scum this time" post.

Post 85 - You ask AP if he has scum and town-meta of you in response to his suspicion and ask whether he has a history of reading you right. It feels more like you are trying to make him look suspicious rather than developing a read.

Post 157 - You ask about the seeming contradiction between AP disliking meta and him using it on you. This seems like a fairer question.

Post 161 - You were at least accurately describing yourself as "throwing shade" on AP. Asking if he considers hypocrisy a scumtell isn't particularly useful.

Post 364 - You townread AP because he says hypocrisy isn't a scumtell. You clarify that you voted Axxle for being "passive" and "active lurking" but that was on page 2 and the only thing he had done then was RVS vote. Post 372 - The frustration with both GC and Yos doing similar things looks town as it seems like Bookitty is trying to figure out alignments but is hitting up on a roadblock. Post 388 - I think this is fair considering your earlier concerns about Yos. Why Yos over GC though?

Post 485 - This clarifies the misunderstanding with the Axxle vote. The continued questions to Yos looked like town trying to read him.

Post 538 - I talked about this earlier but I didn't like the dismissal of the Quar wagon. I could see the Katsuki suspicion making sense from someone that suspected Axxle before.

Post 606 - The post to me about only commenting on wagons. I still don't like it and I don't like the clarification later either. I'd definitely say it was an unfair assessment?

Post 650 - I disagree that you could have laid down a naked vote on Quar and gotten away with it and been "safer yourself." Sooner or later that wagon would be analyzed and your vote would have looked bad. I don't think your actions there (speaking against the Quar wagon) were unlikely to come from scum. I also dislike the use of real life commitments to defend Quar. You say you can sympathize with him because of irl stuff and that's part of why you don't like the wagon but that has nothing to do with his alignment and is objectively a bad reason to defend someone. Your points about the supposed contradiction between Katsuki and AP thinking you were a threat as scum but also hunting for your buddies also aren't very strong. Defending partners isn't necessarily the mark of a poor scum player especially when done convincingly. You again comment on Yos and say that his reads are "all over the place." I'm guessing it could be based on past history (your opening posts suggest that). I'd like to hear a concrete opinion on him.

Going through all of her posts makes me a less sure on Bookitty. I can reasonably follow most of her suspicions and by themselves, there are only a few posts that are troublesome. Most of her descriptions of me or the cases I made seem like misinterpretations or oversimplifications. They could come from lazy town potentially. I didn't like the responses to the suspicion on her from AP. It seemed like she was throwing shade more than addressing them but at least she admits it. The interactions with Yosarian look like they are steeped in past games and I can't decide what it says about either of their alignments just yet. My biggest problem initially with Bookitty was that it seemed like she was posting occasionally, making contributions but not really in a way that shakes things up and was relatively unremarkable. She seems fairly focused on a narrow selection of players (Yosarian, AP, Ax/Katsuki) and defends Quar for real life reasons - although the last had a defiant town feel to it. ALRIGHTY, I finally took a good solid look through Bookitty's posts and have decided that I'm super wrong about her being scum.

Here are the notes I took as I read:

My scumdar is confused. I really liked her questions to AP in posts #85, #157 and #161, it's clear she smells a rat in what AP has been saying about her and she really nails him on his hypocrisy (even if she agrees with him that it's not a scumtell for him).

I'm confused by what she was trying to get at with her question to Yos in post #293. It's a question that seemingly isn't prompted by anything Yos has said about AP or asked her, and she mentions she specifically wants his response before giving her opinion, noting that she's "pretty sure they won't be the same thing." I mean, this reads to me like she's found something alignment-indicative about AP's early game shenanigans and she has some idea of what she thinks Yos will think about it, but she doesn't follow up on Yos's answer at all, and when she next mentions her read on AP it doesn't include anything specific about the "meltdown." @Bookitty: where were you going with that—what's your opinion on what distinguishes AP!meltdown-town from AP!awkward-scum and why were you expecting Yos to have a different one to you?

It's odd that she does not respond to Yos after he replies to her massive attack on him / defense of GC in post #372. She says "that's an invitation to engage with me" and then doesn't engage with his response at all.

Also odd: in #364 she says she voted Axxle because she "felt like he was passive AND active lurking" and then in post #485 she says it was "because of his initial comment, which struck me as just wrong in a lot of ways"... it's not a direct contradiction, necessarily. But I think it's strange she didn't mention the problems she had with his initial comment in her first post about him.

Sigh, okay. I really think she is town for pursuing the fact that nobody's posting a case on her that she can defend herself from. The line to Quaroath in #695 "You don't like it when a question is framed to you that presupposes you are scum -- that is pretty much how I've felt from the start here" reads as hella genuine too. Argh. I also agree with her meta assessment of SleepyKrew in #772 and I like the way she's pursued her suspicions on Katsuki.

UNVOTE: Bookitty

Other reads

Yos: I remember being suspicious of Yos earlier because it looked like he was changing his vote a lot. But, looking now, I buy into his explanations for voting new people and they look like they naturally arise as a result of his old scumreads fizzling out a bit. Furthermore, while I didn't agree with his case on Green Crayons it was at least internally consistent and well-argued and I really liked that he consciously made the decision in post #307 not to continue their back-and-forth because he felt it would clutter up the thread. Also I like his #698 <.<

SleepyKrew: vote's probably gonna go here next unless I find anything scummier from other people. As I've already mentioned, I agree with Bookitty that his townmeta is considerably more combative. Additionally, he doesn't appear to have anything close to resembling a consistent train of thought (most of his posts have just been replies to the newest posts in the thread at the time). He voted and unvoted Pegasus, Katsuki and now has voted DrDolittle without mentioning any sort of suspicion of them in earlier posts. At all. .___.' His sudden push on me also strikes me as kiiiiiinda suspicious considering I've got the most votes and we're close to deadline. And I don't think it's consistent with him asking me why I haven't brought up my town meta, as I've explained. :I PEELY.

Empire / lalaladucks: I have consistently had no idea whatsoever about what to think of his much-discussed super weird posts #36 and #40, except that I thought the lack of specificity in his reads in the latter felt a bit out of character. I did like how straightforward he was in his replies to people, though. I also super agreed with his #467 at the time he posted it, and since I was in a similar position with him re: having an "extremely nebulous hold" on the game, I felt like it pointed towards our thought patterns being similar. My assessment of Empire's scum meta is that he's not bad at it at all, and is capable of putting impressive amounts of effort into it, but that he just really hates playing it and the stress of deception really takes it out of him. To me, his overall pattern of play doesn't look like that. lalala's entrance is profoundly underwhelming though.
